entry.title: Find Cgi-bin Dir on a Linux Server
entry.content:
bash ps -ef | grep cgi

On my server, this will give out the cgi-bin dir.

entry.title: Kill a Tmux Window
entry.content:
When we are using tmux and stuck there, we can then follow the following steps to kill the window.

bash tmux list-windows tmux kill-window -t $window_number

entry.title: Remove Obsolete Packages on Ubuntu
entry.content:
After upgrading ubuntu to a new version, there will be many obsolete packages. To see these packages, you can

bash sudo apt-get upgrade It will list all those obsolete packages.

To autoremove them one by one will be will tedious, we can first copy those packages into a file, like aa.txt, then use the following perl script to do it once:

pl use File::Slurp; my @modules; my $text = read_file('aa.txt', text_ref => 1); @modules = grep {not /\s+/} split('[\s+]', $text); foreach my $module (@modules){ system("sudo apt-get autoremove $module"); }

Done!

entry.title: Login to Mysql Server Without Entering Password
entry.content:
Enter the user name and password in a shell script in the following way will make the login process easier.

bash mysql -h $host -u$user -p$pass $db
